You can create an KeltnerChannels indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

KeltnerChannels()1/1

            KeltnerChannels QuantConnect.Indicators.KeltnerChannels (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
    Decimal                      k,
    *MovingAverageType           movingAverageType,
   )

Creates a new Keltner Channels indicator. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose Keltner Channel we seek.
Int32 period The period over which to compute the Keltner Channels.
Decimal k The number of multiples of the AverageTrueRange from the middle band of the Keltner Channels.
*MovingAverageType movingAverageType (Optional) Specifies the type of moving average to be used as the middle line of the Keltner Channel.
(Optional) The resolution.
*Func<IBaseDataBar> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to casting the input value to a TradeBar.

Return

KeltnerChannels - The Keltner Channel indicator for the requested name.

Definition at file Indicators/KeltnerChannels.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private KeltnerChannels _kch;
// In Initialize()
_kch = new KeltnerChannels(period, k);
_kch.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _kch, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_kch.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _kch.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.kch = KeltnerChannels(period, k)
self.kch.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.kch, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.kch.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.kch.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the KeltnerChannels indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private KeltnerChannels _kch;
// In Initialize()
_kch = new KeltnerChannels(period, k);

// In OnData()
if (data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _kch.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol]);
}
if (_kch.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _kch.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.kch = KeltnerChannels(period, k)

# In OnData()
if data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.kch.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol])
if self.kch.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.kch.Current.Value
